captions.text: So from our TL;DR last week when we talked about the ideal man
A lot of people have been asking what the ideal woman is like for Korea
Oh, I thought you were going to say "What's the ideal hamster"
I would prefer dwarf hamster because dwarf hamsters can live together in union
But it you have a normal hamster
Like a teddy bear hamster
And you put another hamster in there and they fight each other to the death
Martina knows this because she actually owned hamsters growing up
I think they're wonderful
Bear and Moca, R.I.P.
bought a little liquor for your homies
So, to answer your question about what the ideal woman is like in Korea
It's a very complicated process
If you remember last week, there was a whole list or requirements
when it comes to ideal woman in Korea
You have to be pretty.
So that's it for this week's TL;DR, if you have a question for next TL;DR
Leave your question in the comment section below.
I'm actually joking
There is a little bit more that we're going to say about this
Are we joking?
Are we, though?
Are we?
That's pretty much the main requirement that you need as a woman.
If you're pretty, then pretty much all the other requirements on the list aren't that important
So obviously, there are people in Korea that get married because they love each other genuinely
And they aren't looking at a lost of requirements or anything.
And a lot of men in Korea are looking for more than just prettiness when it comes to a girl
But when it comes to the general standard
Pretty much prettiness is the most important thing.
I mean, it's difficult to not say that for the rest of the world too.
I know, it's not like this is a Korea thing only!
Yeah and I know you guys aren't going to say something like...
I'm looking for someone who is kind, caring and super ugly.
I want someone whose teeth look like they chew bricks.
That's something that's really important to me.
BUT what we're getting at is that there is an undeniable logic
That comes to dating in Korea
outside of that whole realm of
"I'd like to fall in love with someone"
And this brings us back to the concept of
Sogaeting~
Sogaeting, man.
What is that all about?
Whoa, your Jamaican accent makes me cringe on the inside
I only had a couple of Jamaican friends...
I grew up with them.
You grew up with My Jamaican friends?
I grew up with every Jamaican person in North America.
Really? All of them?
They all lived in your neighborhood?
Word.
Then do your Jamaican accent if you're so good at it.
I won't bumbleclod do it.
Ok?
Ginger beer
Oh my God.... oh...
So in our last TL;DR on the ideal male type we mentioned Sogaeting
What is basically blind dating in Korea
And this isn't something that desperate sad people do.
This is a very normal part of Korean culture
From lots of age levels.
Like from your 20s up unto your 30s
Whatever.
That's a Very small margin!
From your 20s to your 30s
Because you are expected to be married by then.
So that's why...
If not, you failed your life.
well, SooZee told me there was a different thing, that's for meeting people that is Just for getting married
Wait, wait. I remember this.
It was like My Son! Maiseon? [S]Hot sun?
What's it called, SooZee?
Matseon.
See? Matseon.
You're like "This is for my son~"
You can say like Matseon.
Anyways, sogaeting.
Since sogaeting is such an important part of dating culture.
That whole idea of list of requirements to match somebody
Is something that's on the forefront of dating.
So then Why is it that Korean guys have a much shorter list of requirements when it comes to sogaeting?
Well men do have the ideal look type when it comes to prettiness
The bagel yo
oh yes, bagelyo
Does that mean my face is of the size of a bagel?
Exactly.
And you have a hole in the middle.
Oh my God. That is terrible now that I thought that over!
Get your mind out of the gutter, Missy!
Actually bagel is a condensed(compound) word of baeigeul meaning baby and gul for glamor
So bagel. Like a baby glamorous face.
Yes. Above baby face means cute and young, youthful looking
And the the glamorous doesn't necessarily mean
Beyonce~
It means more like a curvy, big boobidy body
I guess that kind of Does mean Beyonce.
And you should be sexy and feminine but also innocent and aegyo (cute)
Cute and sexy at the same time
I'm not too sure how those things come together.
You're like "Oppa, I'm scared and So glamorously confident!"
Ok, so you've got the looks out, but why is it that guys don't really care about that many other things?
So you've got to think of it this way:
A Korean guy has that pressure that he should attend a SKY university.
Which we talked about last week.
So he has to study his ass off through high-school
Which means no dating
Trust me on that. Our high school students in Korea...
They're REALLY studying
Hagwons, after school tutoring
you get into a SKY university. You're like "YES!"
And you're doing ok in SKY university
Which means that you're going to go on to get into a big company job
or government job
And you're going to be well off.
So in turn that means that if you Do have a future wife
she doesn't really have to have job
Because you're going to be guaranteed to get a well paying job
So she can be a stay-at-home mom or stay-at-home wife
Which is what a lot of Korean women wind up doing
So if you're going to be a stay-at-home mo once you get married
Then what does it matter what university you went to?
What does it matter what job that you have?
Because you're pretty much going to abandon that when you start taking care of your family at home.
That's right. And I mean, if you go to SKY university the whole point is to get you a better career
But if you're not going to have a career
Then it doesn't really matter that you attend a SKY university
So in turn the only thing that really matters is for you to be pretty
So that you could pass on good genes to your kids
It's kind of harsh. I know it's very old-fashioned, but that's pretty much the reason behind it.
Now here's the thing:
There Are some other things that they're looking for:
Obviously they don't want someone who they don't like what so ever
you should obviously like each other.
You're going have to get along well.
They're thinking about these kind of things.
But if they go to a SKY university, that means they are looking for someone who is either
at the same university or lower than them.
They don't want someone who is better educated and has a better job than them
And then they feel like they're not really oppas taking care of you
kind of just like "oh, my girlfriend makes more money than me and has a better job than me"
There's still that old-fashioned mentality of "the man is the one that takes care of the family
He is the breadwinner. While the mother stays home and takes care of all the kids"
Hey, remember that one year in Bucheon
When I was teaching in my 3rd year of teaching
And you were unemployed and stayed at home in your PJs
And worked on building the EYK website?
you know what that's called? That's called having a sugar momma
And it's Awesome!
It's great!
Strongly recommend it. Give it a shot if you can!
So the final thing we want to point out here is that
there are some women that Do want to keep their careers
And they want to keep working while they're married
The problem is that there still might be an old-fashioned mentality with your husband
which it's totally fine that you're working. It's great that you can have double income.
Of course, bring in more money if you're doing that, but...
You've still got to take care of the kids and make me dinner when I get home.
So the problem is that: do you really want to have a full-time job
AND come home and make full Korean suppers and also take care of the kids
and do cleaning in the house. While your husband just has his job.
That seems like a pretty bad deal.
Totally unfreakin fair
Now this is a very big topic and there's still a lot that we want to talk about.
We mention in our blogpost when it comes to gender and equality and the dynamics of a family.
So make sure you click on the link right here
if you want to read more about it.
So what do you guys think about all of this?
Is this something that's unique to Korean culture
Or is it something that you have experience in your culture as well?
Let us know in the comment section below.
So that's it for this week's TL;DR
If you have a question for next week's TL;DR
Leave your question in the comment section below.
Or check out the questions already asked
And if you like them, thumb them up to bring them to our attention.
And don't forget to subscribe for more TL;DRs
Where we teach you about the dynamics of marriage
The first important thing is that you have to make your own love language.
Ducky......... when are we going to go to get something to eat?
I think we're going to go after when we get to finish this.
And after....... [Martina... Are you trying to kill me? *giggle*]
This is actually how we talk to each other when we're off camera.
Like furbies.
I think this is the first time anyone has actually seen us talking like this.
Let's see if anyone can actually understand us
